UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Cesin, a short natural variant of nisin, displays potent antimicrobial activity against major pathogens despite lacking two C-terminal macrocycles
Literature.Author: Guo L, Wambui J, Wang C, Muchaamba F, Broos J, Tasara T, Kuipers OP, Stephan R

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Lactococcus lactis MG1363(MIC=1.28µg/ml),Listeria monocytogenes LMG 10470(MIC=41.0µg/ml),Listeria monocytogenes TT82E(MIC=10.25µg/ml),Listeria monocytogenes LK132(MIC=41.0µg/ml),Bacillus cereus CH-85(MIC=>41.0µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus LMG 10147(MIC=20.5µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus LMG 15975(MIC=20.5µg/ml),Enterococcus faecium LMG 11423(MIC=41.0µg/ml),Enterococcus faecium LMG 16003(MIC=>41.0µg/ml),Enterococcus faecalis LMG 16216(MIC=>41.0µg/ml)
